Attribute.Description: The name of the job.
The name of the product / app to use.
The version of the product / app to use.
The operation supported by the specified product version to carry out.

The path to your .blend file expressed relative to the remote project folder. If your project name is 'sample_project' then remote root becomes '/sample project'. The render file path would then be '/sample project/sample.blend'.
The frame ranges to render. Specified in the following format 'start [end] [step],[start [end] [step]],...'.
The render engine to use when rendering the scene.
The prefix to add to render results.
The output format to use when rendering the scene.

(Optional) The name of the folder your render results will be output to. If your project name is 'sample_project' and you specify 'example_name' for your output folder name then your render results will be output to '/sample project/example_name/'. A timestamped value is used by default if none is provided.
(Optional) The local path to download your render results. If no path is specified it will save the results to a folder called '{desktop}/{project_name}/render_results/{timestamp}/'
If enabled Envoy will automatically download all new (or modified) files saved to the remote output folder to your local download path.
The type of machine to use for the job.
The maximum number of instances you want to run your job on. Note by default it will use the maximum number of instances you can use based on your service level.
The name of the job.
The name of the product / app to use.
The version of the product / app to use.
The operation supported by the specified product version to carry out.

The path to your .vrscene file expressed relative to the remote project folder. If your project name is 'sample_project' then remote root becomes '/sample project'. The render file path would then be '/sample project/sample.vrscene'.

The path to your .remap file expressed relative to the remote project folder. If your project name is 'sample_project' then remote root becomes '/sample project'. The remap file path would then be '/sample project/sample.remap'.
The frame ranges to render. Specified in the following format 'start [end] [step],[start [end] [step]],...'.
Defines the render output width
Defines the render output height
The prefix to add to render results.
The output format to use when rendering the scene.

(Optional) The name of the folder your render results will be output to. If your project name is 'sample_project' and you specify 'example_name' for your output folder name then your render results will be output to '/sample project/example_name/'. A timestamped value is used by default if none is provided.
(Optional) The local path to download your render results. If no path is specified it will save the results to a folder called '{desktop}/{project_name}/render_results/{timestamp}/'
If enabled Envoy will automatically download all new (or modified) files saved to the remote output folder to your local download path.
The type of machine to use for the job.
The maximum number of instances you want to run your job on. Note by default it will use the maximum number of instances you can use based on your service level.
The name of the job.
The name of the product / app to use.
The version of the product / app to use.
The operation supported by the specified product version to carry out.

The path to your .svl job script expressed relative to the remote project folder. If your project name is 'sample_project' then remote root becomes '/sample project'. The render file path would then be '/sample project/sample.svl'.

(Optional) The name of the folder your results will be output to. If your project name is 'sample_project' and you specify 'example_name' for your output folder name then your results will be output to '/sample project/example_name/'. A timestamped value is used by default if none is provided.
(Optional) The local path to download your results. If no path is specified it will save the results to a folder called '{desktop}/{project_name}/render_results/{timestamp}/'
If enabled Envoy will automatically download all new (or modified) files saved to the remote output folder to your local download path.
Any run-specific options (e.g. -lig blah.mdb)
The type of machine to use for the job.
The maximum number of instances you want to run your job on. Note by default it will use the maximum number of instances you can use based on your service level.
A blender 2.79 project setup to use the Blender Cycles render engine.
A blender 2.79 project setup to use the Blender Internal render engine.
A blender 2.8X project setup to use the Blender Cycles render engine.
A blender 2.8X project setup to use the Blender Eevee render engine.
The render engine the project is set to use.
The render engine the project is set to use.
The main .blend file for your project.
The main .blend file for your project.
The version of Blender.
A V-Ray project.
The V-Ray re-map file for the project.
The main .vrscene file for the project.
The version of V-Ray.
A MOE project.
The primary SVL batch script to run.
The version of MOE.
A GridMarkets product.

Item.Description: Blender is a professional, free and open-source 3D computer graphics software toolset used for creating animated films, visual effects, art, 3D printed models, interactive 3D applications and video games.
V-Ray is a computer-generated imagery rendering software application developed by the Bulgarian company Chaos Group, that was established in Sofia in 1997.

Description: Molecular Operating Environment (MOE) is a drug discovery software platform that integrates visualization, modeling and simulations, as well as methodology development, in one package. MOE scientific applications are used by biologists, medicinal chemists and computational chemists in pharmaceutical, biotechnology and academic research.

Attribute.Description: The name of the project as specified in Envoy.
